name: Ceiling Framing ITP
Set Out
Reflected ceiling plans current revisions checked and ceiling set out completed as per the current plans
Construction Generally
Install & fix to prevent looseness or rattling of ceiling components
Ceiling systems do not amplify structural-borne sounds.
Install the ceiling to allow for differential movement at abutting surfaces
Post tensioned concrete: Minimum embedment for fixing: 45mm and minimum clearance of fixing from any tendon: 25mm
Construction – Suspension system
Provide suspension system and workmanship as per supplier installation guides & KCL Design
Services: Do not fix to the installed services. Where services obstruct the ceiling supports, provide bridging and suspension on each side of the services.
Provide additional back support or suspension members to prevent distortion, overloading or excessive vertical deflection.
Ensure that the failure of any one suspension point does not cause a progressive failure of the ceiling.
Provide height adjustment with a length adjustment device at each suspension point, permitting length variation of at least 50mm

Seismic resistant: Provide bracing and clips to framing members to prevent lateral movement and to resist seismic action. Do not provide visible fixings (screws or rivets) where they will be exposed to view.
Uplift: Suspension system and framing to resist uplift.
Tolerances: Flatness, twist, winding and bow: 1.5 mm deviation from a 1.5m straightedge places in any position
Suspension system completed – Ready for installation of ceiling tiles, lining and panels.
Confirm all service trades are complete & ready for closing in of ceiling
Bulkheads
Integrate bulkheads with the ceiling structure and brace to prevent lateral movement. Where ceiling is terminated at the bulkhead, provide for seismic requirements
Smoke baffles and acoustic baffles
Provide approved smoke and acoustic baffles secured fixed to metal angles and smoke sealed at board joints and to adjoining building elements
Partition Lining ITP
Board Lining – Inspection
Run sheets across the framing members (refer GIB standard details)
Stagger end joints in a brick pattern and locate them on framing members away from the corners of large opening
Achieve level of finish as specified in the Material, Component & Finishes Schedule (Sec 4.2)
Multiple sheet layers: Fill & flush up all joints and fixings in each layer and caulk up perimeters and penetrations before commencing succeeding layers.
Stagger all sheet joints by minimum 200mm
Doors & Internal Window Opening: Check Door schedule, Window schedule and Kit of parts
Board joints: Do not fix the lining to abutting building surfaces
Butt joints: Provide perforated paper reinforcing tape
External corners: Provide matching purpose made beads
Internal corners: Provide paper tape and bedding compound
Provide sealants at junctions between partition systems and with other building elements
Provide trim such as beads, moulding and stops to make neat junctions between lining components, finishes and adjacent surfaces
Additional Checks for Fire Walls – Inspections
Installed as per GIB design & install specification
Correct FRL achieved
Deflection heads and all joints sealed, taped and set (Fire Sealant is approved prior)
All penetrations through fire walls below and above ceiling protected/sealed
Additional Checks for Smoke Walls - Inspections
Installed as per GIB design & install specification
Deflection heads and all joints sealed, taped and set (Sealant is approved prior)
All penetrations through smoke walls below and above ceiling protected/sealed
Additional Checks for Acoustic Walls – Inspections
Installed as per GIB design & install specification.
Deflection heads and all joints sealed, taped and set (Sealant is approved prior)
All penetrations through acoustic walls below and above ceiling protected/sealed
Documents
Structural design, documentation and certification for secondary structural steel elements providing support for partitions and fixtures
Samples and prototypes submitted and approved (Fire sealants approved)
Test results of prototypes submitted
Partition Framing ITP
Set Out
Partitions set out plans current revisions checked and wall set out competed as per the current plans
Stud Framing / Wall Strapping – Inspection
Check sizes and spaces as per the partition types / KCL Design.
Fix tracks ≤600mm centres and 100mm from ends
Fixing to post tensioned concrete: Maximum embedment for fixings = 45mm
Install boxed double studs / Maxi Jambs at jambs to all openings
Part height partitions: Brace as per KCL Design
Full height partitions: Fix deflection head tracks to the floor slab soffit to allow a minimum deflection capacity of 20mm.
Achieve overlap of at least 30 mm of the deflection head channel’s section vertical leg with the top plate of the wall framing
Rotate intermediate studs into tracks for friction fixing
Staggered stud framing walls: Studs staggered at 300mm centres set in oversized top & bottom plates to allow each face to have stud fixing at 600mm centres minimum or as per KCL fixing requirement
Structural floor control joints: Disconnect partitions over joints with detached double studs and ensure bottom tracks, bracing and top tracks are not fastened across joints
Stud service holes: Splice additional stiffening to studs if site cut service holes exceed 1/3 the width of the member
Provide fire, smoke and acoustic sealing where indicated on the drawings/details
Ceiling Lining ITP
Construction – Tile ceiling, Grid ceiling, Lining
Provide board lining to a finish and workmanship as per supplier installation guides.
Fit accurately and neatly, without distortion and free from air leakage and staining.
Clip locks: Where ceiling units are exposed to loads from wind actions or as required, insert lock clips at the junction of carrier rails and units.
Set out patterned or heavily textured materials with a consistent direction of pattern or texture.
Cut ceiling unit edges: conceal, or finish to match prefinished edges.

Multiple sheet layers to fire rated and acoustic rated elements: Fill & flush up all joints and fixings in each layer and caulk up perimeters and penetrations before commencing succeeding layers. Stagger all sheet joints by minimum 200mm.
Board joints support: Provide framing parallel to the joint on each side. Do not fix the lining to abutting building surfaces
Flush joints: Provide recessed edge sheets and finish flush using perforated paper reinforcing tape. Locate & position joints to intersect light fixtures, vents or air diffusers.
Tolerances: Suspension system bearing surface for flush lined ceiling to AS/NZS 2589 table 4.2.2
Levelness: Max tolerance of ±5 mm relative to the documented height datum for the particular ceiling in each room or space.
Trims & accessories: Provide trims at junctions with other building elements and surfaces, including walls, beams and penetrations
Control joints
Align ceiling control joints with the structural control joints. Do not bridge structural control joints.
Provide purpose made metallic coated control joint beads where documented.
Provide framing parallel to the joint on each side.
Plasterboard lining: 12m centres
Fibre cement lining: 7.2m centres
Infection control: Provide full depth paintable sealant, finished flush with the face of the lining, to locate where documented
Bulkheads
Integrate bulkheads with the ceiling structure and brace to prevent lateral movement. Where ceiling is terminated at the bulkhead, provide for seismic requirements
Access panels
Match the access panels to the ceiling in appearance and performance
Provide each access panel with an ID
Provide access panels supported and anchored to permit ready removal and refixing
Reinforce the back of the access panel to prevent warping and facilitate handling
Provide fire rated and acoustic rated panels where documented or where required to maintain the designated rating of the ceiling element
Additional checks for fire-protective board lining
Check the fire resistance levels: Drawings and Spec Sec 4.6 Misc. Items Schedule
Fixings: Direct to concrete elements and to purpose made steel framing
Penetrations: Seal penetrations in the board lining to maintain the integrity of the required fire resistance level including suspended ceiling hangers and suspension systems for services.
Board perimeter: Provide fire sealant and trims at junctions with other building elements and surfaces, including walls, beams and penetrations to maintain the required fire resistance levels.
Label each fire stopping to AS/NZS 2589.1
